org.nodes.walks

Class Walks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodes.walks.Walks

  • public class Walks
extends java.lang.Object

    This class provides several factories for Walks, Iterables over graphs. The point of this class is to make it simple to traverse graphs.

    For example: 

                    // * Follow a given track
                List track = Arrays.asList("a", "b", "c", "d");
                for( : Walks.track(graph, track))
                        ...

                // * Look for a label depth first 
                String target = "z";
                for( String label : Walk.depthFirst(graph, graph.get(0)) )
                        if(label.equals(target))
                                ...
    Author:
    peter

    • Method Detail

      • breadthFirst

        public static <L> Walk<L> breadthFirst(Graph<L> graph,
                       Node<L> root)
        Returns a breadth first walk that visits each node in the graph exactly once. The walk maintains a history of nodes it has already returned, unless the graph is guaranteed acyclic (because it implements Acyclic.
        Type Parameters:
        L - The type of node labels in the graph
        N - The node-type of the graph
        Parameters:
        graph - The grap
        root - The node to start the walk.
        Returns:
